subhead: As Ukraine negotiates an end to the war, Volodymyr Zelensky had to part ways with his chief diplomat, Andriy Yermak, a political lightning rod and a close friend. The Ukrainian president is doing everything to downplay the departure of his right-hand man.

subhead: The journalist, who was sentenced in the first instance to seven years in prison for advocating terrorism, had his sentence upheld by the Tizi Ouzou Court of Appeal on Wednesday.

title: How Edouard Philippe hopes to succeed Macron
subhead: Sixteen months ahead of France's presidential election, the center-right former prime minister has been working to establish himself as the natural choice successor to Emmanuel Macron. He has ruled out participating in a primary with other contenders.

title: In Paris, five spots to enjoy a (great) plant-based sandwich
subhead: A 'dwich' with button mushrooms in the style of roast chicken, a Japanese snack with sweet or savory options, a banh mi without meat or Maggi sauce: Here is our selection of Parisian spots to savor delicious vegetarian sandwiches.

title: PFAS: France's tap water is widely polluted with TFA, the most common 'forever chemical'
subhead: A French state health agency analyzed over 600 samples of drinking water. 92% of them contained traces of trifluoroacetic acid (TFA), the smallest PFAS molecule, which is suspected to be toxic.

subhead: Le Monde spoke with survivors of the takeover of the capital of North Darfur by paramilitary forces at the end of October. They described summary executions, rapes, large-scale human trafficking and efforts to cover up the crimes committed.

title: 'Mektoub, My Love: Canto Due': Abdellatif Kechiche's Mediterranean gem
subhead: The director of 'Blue Is the Warmest Color' is releasing the final installment of his trilogy set in Sète, weaving a tale of intrigue and burning desire. It is a film of reconciliations and reunions, with characters who never fail to surprise.

title: The significant trade imbalance between France and China
subhead: Even as Chinese competition increasingly undermines French industries, including in innovation, many French companies argue that maintaining a presence in China remains essential. President Emmanuel Macron is visiting the country from December 3 to 5.
